name: PixelFem #69 - Lesley Brown
description:
Lesley Brown struggled for nine years to conceive naturally, only to be diagnosed with bilateral fallopian tube obstruction. She was referred to Dr. Patrick Steptoe in 1976, a forerunner in the field of gynecological laparoscopy, and told there was a procedure she could try to become pregnant. When Lesley Brown gave birth to her daughter Louise in 1978, they called her a “test-tube baby.” Today, we know the technique Brown pioneered—one that has helped millions of couples have children despite fertility struggles—as in vitro fertilization, or IVF.

✺This work is part of PixelFems, an evolving project on the Tezos blockchain celebrating iconic women from the past and present✺
